title: Hotel Cellar Liquidation: How to Sell Wine and Spirits Inventory
metaTitle: Hotel Liquor & Wine Liquidation Services | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Hotels often hold massive value in cellar inventory. Learn how to liquidate excess stock during renovation, management change, or closure.
summary: Practical steps for large, mixed inventories including case counts, storage notes, and approvals.

sections.heading: Quick Answer
content: Hotels accumulate 'dead stock' in F&B outlets easily. Converting this to cash improves the P&L immediately.
list: Audit the main cellar and separate 'Active' lists from 'Deep Storage'.
We buy high-end wines (Bordeaux, Cab), Scotch, and unopened back-bar spirits.
We manage the logistics (palleting/shrink-wrapping) if needed.
Payment can go to the property or the holding company.

sections.heading: When to Liquidate
list: Renovation: Closing a restaurant concept? Sell the inventory that won't fit the new theme.
Management Change: New F&B Director wants to clear old buys and start fresh.
Cash Flow: Reduce holding costs on slow-moving inventory.

sections.heading: Handling F&B Inventory
list: Bin Cards: Often inaccurate. A physical count is mandatory.
Condition: Check if wines were stored in the warm kitchen vs. the cool cellar.
Open Bottles: We cannot buy open bottles. Staff them out or pour them.

sections.heading: Authorization Steps
list: GM or Director of Finance must sign off.
Check with legal regarding state laws on selling back to a license holder.
We provide a detailed Purchase Agreement to satisfy auditors.

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
list: Selling to staff at cost (lose potential profit).
Running a '50% off' special (devalues the brand image).
Letting inventory walk out the back door.

sections.heading: What to Do Next
list: Export your POS inventory report to Excel.
Mark the items you want to sell.
Email it to us for a line-item bid.
Schedule a site visit if the collection is substantial.

faqs.question: Do you buy banquet wine?
faqs.answer: Usually no. High-volume, low-cost wines have little resale secondary value. We want the Reserve List.

faqs.question: Can you clear the room in 24 hours?
faqs.answer: Yes, expedited removal is a specialty of ours.

faqs.question: Do you buy mini-bar minis?
faqs.answer: No. Too small and low value.

faqs.question: What if labels have our sticker?
faqs.answer: That's fine. We can remove stickers or sell as is.

faqs.question: Can we swap inventory?
faqs.answer: We generally do cash buyouts, not trades, which keeps the accounting cleaner.
